page.title: 02Clifton - Local History
page.content: Clifton on Dunsmore (which takes its name from the hill "clive" meaning cliff)was mentioned in the first Domesday survey of 1087.The different architectural styles of the houses show how the village has developed over the last 900 years. The greatest expansion being in the last 150 years, however, with the building of the canal and railway,and the development of Rugby as an industrial area. From the church tower of Saint Mary The Virgin,one can see into three counties-Warwickshire,Leicestershire and Northhamptonshire. At the last national census taken in 1981,there were 1332 people living in Clifton.In 1885 there were 379 inhabitants.
